I look forward to the day, 40 years from now, when I tell my grandkids about the crazy years of Trump and how we made it through.

But that dream hinges on this Republican Party never holding power again.

Otherwise, they’ll burn it all to the ground - literally and otherwise.

If I were a candidate this cycle, I’d be relentlessly talking about how dangerous every single Republican politician has become.

Anti-democracy, anti-choice, anti-law enforcement, and anti-national security.

Shout it from the rooftops. The Republican Party must be defeated.

At this point, there’s going to be a lengthy legal process over where Trump is going to serve time with about 3 states and federal facilities all vying for the dubious distinction.

And a bunch of Republicans are bound and determined to go down with the Trump shipwreck.

They’ll never admit they’ve lied, cheated - or broken the law. Even when caught red handed.

Donald Trump is the worst thing that’s ever happened to America.

The division and embrace of right wing conspiracy and distrust has brought us to a boiling point.

Trump is a criminal - always has been. And those still defending him aren’t much better.

Donald Trump was right about almost nothing.

But he was right about something. He really could shoot someone on 5th Avenue or apparently steal nuclear secrets and Republicans wouldn’t care.

If you still believe in accountability @ Republicans, you’ll demand it here.

Michael Flynn has long been reported to have tried selling nuclear secrets to the Saudis.

That seems significant.

And now that the #MAGA has taken over the GOP, they’ve gone full fascist.

There’s no economic, fiscal, or pro-democracy reason to elect almost any Republican.

0% inflation and continued record low unemployment in July.

My entire life, Democrats have been cleaning up the economic messes of Republican administrations.

Right wing, trickle down economics has never worked - except for the wealthy.
Trump has always been his own worst enemy. His privilege has kept him out of jail thus far. https://t.co/bDoM046mFC

For the sake of justice and any pretense of it, Donald Trump must be indicted.

Every hearing thus far has painted a clear picture:

Donald Trump broke the law. 

And his enablers in his administration and in Congress likely did too.

We're arriving at a tipping point. 

Will we repudiate the lies and vote FOR action on protecting women's rights, gun safety, and protecting our democracy?

Or will we further enable the radical far-right movement where truth need not apply?

And not even just candidates. We see it in state legislatures, county commissions - even the US House and Senate in the form of Greene, Boebert, and Tuberville.

GOP voters have refused to repudiate the lies and extremism which has led to a snowball effect.

Most GOP politicians don't believe what they tell voters (e.g., the election was stolen, socialism, CRT, 'wokeness').

They say it to inspire fear and drum up votes.

The problem?

Decades of fear-mongering have led to Republican candidates that actually believe the lies.

In other words:

“1 million+ die from COVID under our watch but it’s the next guys fault when unemployment is historically low AND jobs can’t be filled.”

“Also, we are against immigration of any kind that would address this!” https://t.co/3tMPCo7bDX

This is Econ 101.

Corporate consolidation and the long-term crowding out of local businesses (e.g., Walmart being the center of many small towns) is how we get “inflation.”

Costs are up due to post-COVID recovery - like shipping costs. But those spaces are consolidated too. https://t.co/76z718kHtb

According to Brett Kavanaugh and the other right-wing justices who were given stolen seats, because dinner isn't mentioned in the Constitution, he has no claim.

That's "Constitutional originalism," right?

Or is "right to privacy" now suddenly something Brett cares about? https://t.co/nlobLStOCi

‘Gun safety? Nay.’
